name: Nanometer
intro: Microscopic scale unit, often used to describe the size of material molecules and particles, adapted for the biological and semiconductor fields.

name: Micrometer
intro: Commonly used in the electronics and optical fields, it can measure precision objects such as chip processes and bacterial sizes.

name: Millimeter
intro: Daily precision measurement unit, suitable for describing the size of screws, paper thickness, and small parts.

name: Centimeter
intro: High-frequency small-scale unit in life, supporting common conversions such as centimeters to inches, adapted for measuring the size of mobile phones and books.

name: Decimeter
intro: Auxiliary unit for medium scales, with low daily usage frequency, mostly used for segmental description of objects.

name: Meter
intro: The SI base unit, defined as the distance traveled by light in a vacuum in 1/299792458 seconds, the core benchmark for length conversion.

name: Kilometer
intro: Long-distance measurement unit, suitable for describing highway mileage, urban spacing, and national territorial area spans.

name: Inch
intro: Common unit in the British and American systems, mostly used in electronic screen size, mechanical manufacturing, and cross-border trade scenarios.

name: Foot
intro: Daily unit in the UK and US, adapted for height measurement, building size, and road sign scenarios.

name: Yard
intro: Special unit for sports events and fabric measurement, commonly seen in football fields and fabric cutting scenarios.

name: Mile
intro: Overseas highway mileage unit, the mainstream long-distance measurement standard in the UK, US, and Commonwealth countries.

name: Nautical Mile
intro: Special unit for navigation and aviation, formulated based on the arc length of the Earth's meridian, convenient for calculating course distance.

name: Chinese Cun
intro: Traditional unit in China, mostly used for measuring traditional fabric cutting and furniture dimensions.

name: Chinese Chi
intro: Folk traditional unit in China, adapted for measuring clothing and wood, and the mobile converter can quickly convert between units.

name: Chinese Li (Market System)
intro: Folk distance unit in China, often used for colloquial distance description, in line with traditional usage habits.

name: Astronomical Unit
intro: Specialized in astronomy, based on the average Earth-Sun distance, describing the distance between celestial bodies in the solar system.

name: Light-Year
intro: Astronomical scale unit, referring to the distance light travels in a vacuum in one year, used to describe the distance between celestial bodies outside the solar system.
